title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Holy Cross Health (Silver Spring, MD) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy & straightforward interview process.  It was almost like I had the job before speaking to anyone.  

I spoke to the recruiter for a phone screen.  She asked me a few basic (and typical) RN interview questions and scheduled a 1:1 interview with the assistant director of the unit I applied to.  She also prepped me on key factors that the assistant director would be looking for.  

My interviewed was scheduled for a little less than 2 weeks after the phone screen.  It was extremely short...maybe 15 minutes.  The assistant director mainly talked about the unit, not too many questions for me.  When the interview was over, I was asked to schedule a shadow day in the near future.

My shadow day was one week later.  I stayed for about 5 hours and shadowed one of the more experienced nurses on the unit.  The nurse told me that after the shadow she has to "recommend" me for the position and I'll most likely be hired.  I got an offer letter email and phone call the next week.  

There is no room for negotiation of pay as a new grad nurse, they  start all ADN prepared nurses at one rate and BSN prepared nurses at a higher (maybe $1-2) rate.   

They need transcripts (at least a 3.0 for ADN), 5 references, and a background check (which takes a ridiculously long time to complete through HireRight).  

Overall the process took about a month.
Interview Questions: Explain how you handled a difficult patient in the past...

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Holy Cross Health
Interview Descriptions: Included a shadow day on the unit, as well as a one-to-one interview with the Nurse Manager. The process lasted about 4-6 hours. It was a very pleasant experience, but did not give me the opportunity to truly see the unit.

title: New Graduate Nurse Interview

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Holy Cross Health (Silver Spring, MD) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about two months after applying to the position by a recruiter. We were playing phone tag so I requested an e-mail with a time to connect. I then received an e-mail with a specified date for an interview to come to an in-person interview for the role, which I thought was strange since we had not spoken at all yet. I decided to attend and waited for 15 minutes past my scheduled interview time. Turned out my name was not on the list. The interview went ok, but to my surprise I was offered the position about a month later for significantly less than the salary noted on my application. It's always good to get out and meet new people, but I truly felt like the interview process was a messy waste of time.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer to complete different tasks one by one or at the same time?

title: Coordinator Interview

title: Registered Nurse (Emergency Department) Interview

title: Pyxis Systems Coordinator Interview

The interviewer and her assistant did not show up until 10:15 and cut the interview short due to a meeting. Two weeks later, no response. I emailed the manager and she never responded to my email. I finally decided to call the main hospital number and ask for HR. I spoke to a recruiter there who had no record of an interview. The gentleman transferred me to the recruiter who set a phone screen up for 9am for the next day. WEll the next day arrived and no phone call., or email. NOTHING! These people have no regards for time and communication does not seem to be huge here.
